sentences: Kuradi, kurjavaimu raisk. Sa viimane, igavene raisk!
Ei see raisk viitsi end liigutada.
context: The Estonian word 'raisk' has multiple meanings: 1) As an interjection, it's a vulgar intensifier expressing displeasure or anger, similar to 'fuck' but less severe; 2) As a noun, it can mean carrion or decomposing carcass in older/dialectal usage; 3) It can also mean waste, garbage, or rubbish. The word carries strong negative connotations and is considered slightly vulgar when used as an interjection.
